Psychological Definition: Physiological needs are the basic requirements for human survival, including food, water, shelter, and rest.

Workplace Definition: In the workplace, physiological needs refer to basic compensation, a safe working environment, and access to necessary facilities and resources.

Leadership Support:
  • Ensure employees receive competitive and fair compensation.
  • Provide clean and safe workspaces.
  • Offer access to healthy food and beverages.
  • Implement reasonable working hours and rest breaks.
